author: Richard W. Roth
content: Perhaps this is a GPS assisted collision, something like the radar assisted collision we studied during radar plotting training. The crew of a vessel puts it on auto pilot tied to a GPS plotter to take them down the channel and begins cleaning nets and sorting fish.

author: Rick Spilman
content: The Bow Belle was a dredger while the Bow Fortune is a tanker. Bow Belle was owned by East Coast Aggregates Limited whereas Bow Fortune is owned by Odfjell. I doubt the tow vessels have anything in common.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: Is there any link between the Bow Fortune and the Bow Belle, another vessel that ran down a party ship on the River Thames killing many people?

author: Rick Spilman
content: With AIS, with a Security Call on a VHS Radio, with someone observing the radar, even with the prudent use of foghorns, it never should have happened.
